result.execSummary:
The defendant Ramale S Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber is granted for employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription. Absolute sobriety is required. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.   CORRECTED 01-28-2016:  CFTS

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

BTC: Total sentence is 6 mos RCJ/CFTS. Huber is granted for employment, DNA sample & costs, costs, FAW/vote

Defendant Ramale S Campbell in court with attorney Antoinette L. Rich.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for Jennifer C Tanck-Adams for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that there is something she needs to work out with Ms. Tanck-Adams and asks for an adj COP  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
ZCI

Ct 1: 961.41(1m)(h)1-Possession w/intent THC (2nd & subsequent offense)  ***ALSO $2500.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea hearing on August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ramale S Campbell in court with attorney Antoinette L. Rich.  Defendant Ramale S Campbell in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking for either $500.00 cash or signature bond. The State objects to any modification of bond - argument put on the record.

BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond may be modified to $1,500.00 cash and $2,500.00 signature - all terms and conditions as previously ordered remain  Plea hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
